intro: Phoradendron laxiflorum, commonly known as the Mexican flame tree, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Bignoniaceae. It is native to Mexico and parts of Central America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. The plant is also known for its ability to grow as a vine or a tree, depending on environmental conditions.
